content.title: Intro
content.content:
2008
Preceded by
2008
2009
Year
2010
Followed by
2010

Tolkien-related events that took place in 2009.

content.title: January
content.content:
3 - Birthday Toast.
9 - The Lord of the Rings: Conquest is released in Europe.
13 - The Lord of the Rings: Conquest is released in North America.
26 - Black & White Ogre Country is published.

content.title: March
content.content:
15 - Arda Reconstructed: The Creation of the Published Silmarillion is published.
17 - The seventh book of The Lord of the Rings Online: Mines of Moria, "Leaves of Lórien", is released.

content.title: April
content.content:
1 - The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: War of the Ring is published.
4 - The Fourth Grand Council of the Sociedad Tolkien Peruana is held in Lima, Peru.
19 - The first e-Book of The Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit and The Children of Húrin are published.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien (1997 documentary) is released on DVD.

content.title: May
content.content:
3 - The Hunt for Gollum, Chris Bouchard's fan film, is released online.
5 - The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún is published.
7 - Cinematic Scripture: The Structure and Usage of The Lord of the Rings as Equipment for Living is published.
? - Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment takes the license from Saul Zaentz Company to produce video games.

content.title: June
content.content:
2 - The Deluxe Edition of The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún is published.
11 - The Road Goes Ever On and On: The Map of Tolkien's Middle-earth is published.
17 - The Hobbitonian Anthology‎ is published.
22 - Tolkien's Bag End is published.
23 - The eighth book of The Lord of the Rings Online: Mines of Moria, "Scourge of Khazad-dûm", is released.
30 - Languages, Myths and History is published.

content.title: July
content.content:
1 - The Tolkien Calendar 2010 and Tolkien Diary 2010 are published.
6 - The Epic Realm of Tolkien: Part One: Beren and Lúthien is published.
17-20 - Mythcon 40.
21 - Artist Heinz Edelmann dies.
24-26 - Tolkien Thing 2009.

content.title: August
content.content:
7 - At Montreal's WorldCon, The Lord of the Rings wins the 2009 Prometheus Hall of Fame Award for the best classic literary work of liberty.
6-9 - Omentielva Nelya - 3rd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Whitehaven, England

content.title: September
content.content:
1 - The Lord of the Films is published.
8 - Halifirien: The Hallowed Mountain is released online.
8 - The Tolkien Estate, The Tolkien Trust and HarperCollins settle their lawsuit with New Line Cinema and the Saul Zaentz Company.
22 - The Frisian translation of The Hobbit, by Anne Tjerk Popkema, is published.
25-27 - Oxonmoot 2009.

content.title: October
content.content:
2-4 - Ring*Con 2009.
3 - Author Gisbert Kranz dies.
5 - The History Channel airs Tolkien's Monsters.
14 - Actor Martyn Sanderson dies.
15-18 - Mereth Aderthad XV, or "EstelCon", in Cardona, Spain.
16 - Voice actor Denys Hawthorne dies.
27 - Fantasy novel The Shadow Dragons, featuring J.R.R. Tolkien as a fictional character, is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
6- The Facebook application The One Ring is launched.
23 - Parma Eldalamberon #18 is published.

content.title: December
content.content:
1 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood is released in North America.
1 - Born of Hope is released online.
3 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood is released in Europe.
22 - War of the Fantasy Worlds is published.

(spring) - Mallorn 47 is published.
(autumn) - Mallorn 48 is published.
? - Tolkien Studies: Volume 6 is published.
Years
2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012
